title: Mount Kaplan
text:
Mount Kaplan is a massive <a href="mountain">mountain</a>, the highest in the <a href="Hughes%20Range%20%28Antarctica%29">Hughes Range</a> of <a href="Antarctica">Antarctica</a>, standing 5 km (3 mi) southeast of <a href="Mount%20Wexler">Mount Wexler</a>.
The mountain was discovered and photographed by Admiral <a href="Richard%20E.%20Byrd">Byrd</a> on the Baselaying Flight of November 18, 1929, and surveyed by A.P. Crary in 1957–58. Crary named it for Joseph Kaplan, the chairman of the U.S. National Committee for the <a href="International%20Geophysical%20Year">IGY</a>, 1957–58.
